author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Trump administration is weighing an executive order that would pressure defense contractors to spend less on stock buybacks and dividends while boosting investment in infrastructure and weapons production, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Trump Weighs Pressuring Defense Firms to Cut Buybacks, Dividends

author: Andreo Calonzo, Cliff Harvey Venzon, Rosalind Mathieson
description: Government funds meant to protect communities were allegedly stolen, leaving villages flooded and President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. confronting a political and economic reckoning.
title: Inside the $2 Billion Scandal That Paralyzed the Philippines

description: In one of the most earthquake-prone regions on Earth, where the Tibetan Plateau meets the Himalayas, China is building a colossal hydropower system, pushing engineering and geopolitics to the limit.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: China’s Controversial $167 Billion Mega-Dam

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana, Grace Sihombing
description: Central banks in Thailand and Indonesia will make their last interest rate decisions of 2025 under a cloud of economic challenges from politics to weather.
title: Politics and Disasters Challenge Thai, Indonesian Central Banks

author: Yang Yang, Naomi Ng, K Oanh Ha
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, how kickbacks and fake flood-control projects left the Philippines underwater and investors on edge.
title: The Philippines Poured Billions Into Flood Control — Then It Vanished

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said in a Financial Times op-ed that placing tariffs and quotas on Chinese imports would be “an uncooperative answer” to address its trade imbalance with the European Union.
title: Macron Says Tariffs on Chinese Exports Would Be ‘Uncooperative’

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: MAGA base backs US military strikes on suspected drug-smuggling vessels.
title: Trump Voters Giving Him Latitude for Caribbean Military Strikes

description: West Texas Intermediate oil fell below $55 a barrel for the first time since February 2021 on signs that supply is outpacing demand. Mike McGlone of Bloomberg Intelligence says oil could drop to $40 next year. He's on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oil Hits New Low of the Year at $55 a Barrel

author: Josh Saul, Leonardo Nicoletti, Dina Bass
description: Three Democratic US senators opened an investigation into how data centers are driving up monthly consumer power bills by sending letters demanding answers to seven firms developing the facilities, including Alphabet Inc.’s Google, Microsoft Corp. and Amazon.com Inc.
title: US Lawmakers Investigate Big Tech’s Role Pushing Up Power Bills

description: US job growth remained sluggish in November and the unemployment rate rose to 4.6%, pointing to a continued cooling in the labor market. The rise in the unemployment rate reflected a surge in those returning to the workforce, with the participation rate and the rate for workers age 25-54 also ticking higher. US Department of Labor Chief Economist Julia Pollak believes, however, that the jobs report contains 'two big distortions,' including federal workers coming off payrolls and the prolonged effects of the shutdown, and that the unemployment rate will drop down soon. She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break down the jobs report and the state of the labor market.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Data 'Distortions' Affecting Jobs Report, Says Labor Department's Pollak

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss US job growth remaining sluggish in November and the unemployment rate rising to a four year high, all pointing to a cooling US labor market. Bloomberg's Michael McKee joins the show to break it down. Plus, Whalen Global Advisors Chairman Chris Whalen joins to discuss market risks, private credit, tech investments, and more. Also on today's show, MARA CEO Fred Thiel discusses how bitcoin fatigue is setting in as the token heads for its fourth yearly decline, and US Department of Labor Chief Economist Julia Pollak on today's payrolls data. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Sluggish Jobs Report Hints at Cooling Labor Market | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/16/2025

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump on Tuesday expanded the list of countries facing travel restrictions in the latest move by his administration to crack down on migration following the shooting of two National Guard troops last month.
title: Trump Expands List of Countries Facing Travel Ban Restrictions

description: Jasmine Crockett will face an uphill battle in Texas, even with her ability to command attention, explains Bloomberg Opinion columnist Mary Ellen Klas. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Can TikTok Videos Win Texas?

author: Matthew Bristow
description: The US added Colombia’s largest cocaine cartel to its list of terrorist organizations and threatened to use “all available tools” against such groups it is targeting across Latin America.
title: Trump Adds Colombia’s Biggest Cocaine Cartel to Terrorist List

author: Molly Smith
description: Here’s a shocker — if you give businesses more time to respond to a survey, chances are you’ll get more data back in return.
title: Speed Vs. Accuracy of US Jobs Data Rekindled After Shutdown

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump expressed unhappiness with the owners of Paramount Skydance Corp. over CBS News coverage of his presidency, in the latest signal of how he may be leaning in the battle to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.
title: Trump Slams Paramount Over CBS Coverage as Warner Battle Looms

description:
Bitcoin is headed for its fourth annual decline in its history, falling as much as 5.2% and is now about 7% lower for the year, with volumes low and investors bailing on Bitcoin ETFs. The bear market means Bitcoin has decoupled from stocks, with the S&P 500 closing at a record earlier this month and up 16% for the year, while Bitcoin has struggled to find a footing, indicating traders are staying on the sidelines, at least for now.
MARA Chairman & CEO Fred Thiel, however, expects a great performance from Bitcoin over the course of the coming year despite a 'healthy retracement' in the marketplace. He joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Bitcoin Market Decline a 'Healthy Retracement,' Says MARA's Thiel

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest US economic data. On today's show, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino, Bluestack Strategies Founder Maura Gillespie, Republican Congressman Jason Smith of Missouri and former California Congresswoman Jane Harman. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Speaker Refuses Vote on Health Subsidies | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/16/2025

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Mortgage giant Freddie Mac announced that Kenny M. Smith will be its chief executive officer effective Dec. 17, putting the former Deloitte Consulting LLP vice chairman in a critical position ahead of a long-promised share sale by the Trump administration.
title: Freddie Mac Taps Kenny Smith as CEO With 2026 IPO Possible

description:
House Ways and Means Chair Jason Smith (R-MO0 said the Democrats' plan to extend Obamacare premium subsidies doesn't address the high cost of health insurance for the vast majority of Americans

Speaker Mike Johnson will block a push by moderate House Republicans for a vote on renewing expiring Obamacare subsidies, quashing a last-ditch effort to head off a spike in insurance premiums for more than 20 million Americans.
The Republican speaker’s decision guarantees enhanced Affordable Care Act premium credits expire at the end of the year. Democrats have made clear the congressional Republicans’ refusal to extend the subsidies will figure prominently in a midterm congressional campaign focusing on the high cost of living. A band of swing-district moderates had pushed for a vote this week on adding an extension of the expiring subsidies to Republican health care legislation that the House plans to vote on Wednesday.  
 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Speaker Quashes Hopes for Obamacare Subsidies Vote

author: Natalia Drozdiak
description: President Donald Trump’s base broadly supports his airstrikes against suspected drug-runners in the Caribbean Sea, giving him the political latitude he may need to wage an even more aggressive campaign despite an outcry over its legality.
title: MAGA Support Clears Trump’s Way for More Pressure in Caribbean

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said he would deliver a prime-time address to the nation on Wednesday night, an opportunity to tout his agenda to voters with polls showing the public souring on his approach to the economy.
title: Trump Says He’ll Deliver Prime-Time Address Wednesday Night

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: French prosecutors have asked that ex-President Nicolas Sarkozy face another trial over accusations linked to alleged corrupt Libyan campaign finance that led to his jailing earlier this year.
title: Former French President Sarkozy Risks Second Trial Linked to Libya Finance Conspiracy

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Tyler Kendall
description: The Trump administration threatened retaliation against the European Union in response to efforts to tax American tech companies, singling out prominent companies, including Accenture Plc, Siemens AG and Spotify Technology SA, as possible targets for new restrictions or fees.
title: US Threatens to Retaliate Against EU Companies Over Digital Tax

description: Get a jump start on the US trading day with Matt Miller and Dani Burger on "Bloomberg Open Interest." Mixed messages on the labor market — payrolls bouncing back in November after that October drop. We talk to White House Council of Economic Advisers Acting Chair Pierre Yared. Ford takes a $19.5 billion hit as it rewires its EV strategy, just as the EU backs away from banning combustion engines. Nasdaq wants nearly round-the-clock trading, asking regulators for a 23-hour window. And money managers are turning upbeat heading into the new year — Citadel’s Ken Griffin joins our own Dani Burger in Paris to weigh in markets, the impact of AI and what he sees for NYC's future under Mayor- Elect Mamdani. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ken Griffin on AI, Markets and the Future of NYC | Open Interest 12/16/2025

author: Iain Marlow, Caroline Hyde
description: The Trump administration’s recently released national security strategy was not intended as empty criticism of Europe but was designed to help steer the continent back on track, a top State Department official said.
title: Trump Security Strategy Meant to Guide Europe, US Official Says

author: Josh Saul, Madlin Mekelburg
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton sued Xcel Energy Inc., accusing the utility company of “blatant negligence” over its role in the Smokehouse Creek wildfire that killed three people and caused more than $1 billion in damage last year.
title: Texas Sues Utility Company Xcel Over ‘Blatant Negligence’ in Fatal Wildfire

author: Antonia Mufarech, Carolina Gonzalez
description: There may be no stranger duo on the expanding stage of the global right than Chile’s President-elect José Antonio Kast and Argentina’s libertarian firebrand Javier Milei. Kast, a strict Catholic father of nine, appears with every hair in place, a tie knotted with precision. Lifelong bachelor Milei bursts in sporting a black leather jacket and an unruly mane.
title: Milei Embraces Chile's President Elect, Cementing Right-Wing Alliance

author: Jamie Tarabay, Roxana Tiron
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said the Trump administration will show additional lawmakers the unedited video of a boat strike in the Caribbean Sea that prompted allegations of war crimes, as pressure continues to mount from both parties for its public release.
title: Hegseth to Share Venezuela Boat Strike Video With More Lawmakers

author: James Woolcock
description: The UK’s Labour government passed a workers’ rights package that expands protections for employees and achieves a key policy goal of the party’s left.
title: New Workers’ Rights Will Reshape UK Economy and Show Left’s Might

description: Donald Trump sued the BBC for at least $10 billion over a misleading edit in a documentary about the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol by his supporters. Is the US president likely to win? Shona Ghosh explains. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Sues BBC for $10 Billion Over Panorama Documentary Edit

author: Erik Wasson, Maeve Sheehey, Erin Durkin
description: Speaker Mike Johnson will block a push by moderate House Republicans for a vote on renewing expiring Obamacare subsidies, quashing a last-ditch effort to head off a spike in insurance premiums for more than 20 million Americans.
title: Speaker Blocks House Moderates’ Push to Vote on Health Subsidies

description: Citadel founder Ken Griffin says the Republican party is struggling with policies on tariffs and immigration that are fueling inflation during an interview with Dani Burger at the Conference de Paris. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Ken Griffin Says GOP Grappling With Inflationary Policies

author: Will Standring
description: The UK will probe the role of cryptocurrencies as part of a wider review of the country’s laws on political finance sparked by the bribery case surrounding a Reform UK politician.
title: UK to Examine Crypto Donations in Probe on Party Financing

author: Ott Tammik, Slav Okov
description: European Union member states are discussing a raft of new measures against the shadow fleet to further clamp down on Russia’s circumvention of oil sanctions, according to Estonian Prime Minister Kristen Michal.
title: EU Mulls Targeting Visas in Shadow Fleet Crackdown, Estonia Says

description: Marty Edel, Sports Law Practice Co-Chair at Goulston & Storrs and Adjunct Professor at Columbia University, with Bloomberg News Business of Sports Reporter Randall Williams break down the leading legal headlines from the world of sports. Marty and Randall speak with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: NASCAR, Michael Jordan’s Racing Team Settle Antitrust Suit

description: Bloomberg News Space Reporter Sana Pashankar and Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Defense Analyst Wayne Sanders explain why building President Donald Trump's proposed missile and air defense system would be an enormous task with a pricetag far higher than initial estimates. Sana and Wayne speak with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: The True Cost of Trump's Plan for "Golden Dome"

description: Pierre Yared, acting chair of the White House Council of Economic Advisers, reacts to the November jobs report on "Bloomberg Open Interest." Nonfarm payrolls increased 64,000 in November after declining 105,000 in October, according to Bureau of Labor Statistics data. The unemployment rate was 4.6% last month, up from 4.4% in September. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Jobless Rate Uptick May Be Insignificant, CEA’s Yared Says

author: Will Standring
description: The UK Government is bolstering its housebuilding deregulation with a second update to the national planning policy framework, as Labour risks falling well behind on the house building target at the heart of its election pledges.
title: UK Has Second Go at Planning Reform as Housebuilding Stalls

author: Meghashyam Mali
description: Elon Musk, the chief executive officer of Tesla Inc., was an “avowed” ketamine user, White House Chief of Staff Susie Wiles told Vanity Fair, among a series of candid and occasionally critical remarks she made about President Donald Trump’s inner circle in interviews with the magazine.
title: White House Chief Calls Musk Drug User, VP ‘Conspiracy Theorist’

author: Justin Sink
description: For a man who vowed to stay out of the political spotlight, Jared Kushner is finding himself very much in its glare.
title: Jared Kushner Is Everywhere, From Peace Deals to Big Money Deals

author: Alicia A. Caldwell, Jimmy Jenkins
description: The Trump administration is slashing the ranks of immigration judges in a drive to extend its broader crackdown to the administrative courts where they serve and speed up deportations.
title: Judges Are Getting Fired as Trump Pursues Immigration 'Purge'

author: Julian Lee
description: Crude shipments registered their biggest week-on-week drop since the invasion of Ukraine
title: Russia’s War Chest Hammered as Oil Flows and Prices Plunge

author: Daniel Flatley, Catherine Lucey
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said there are one or two more interviews this week for the next chair of the Federal Reserve, with a likely announcement by President Donald Trump sometime in early January.
title: Bessent Sees One or Two More Fed Chair Interviews This Week

author: Alex Morales
description: Keir Starmer pledged that better times lie ahead for the UK next year, as his government struggles to revive the country’s stagnant economy and his ruling Labour Party stutters in the polls.
title: Starmer Vows Better 2026 as Labour Flags in Stalling UK Economy

author: Jorge Valero, Max Ramsay
description: The European Parliament approved measures to protect European farmers under a potential trade deal with South American countries, a key technical step needed to finalize the landmark pact.
title: EU Parliament Approves Farmer Protections to Ease Mercosur Deal

author: Thomas Seal
description: Canada wants to work more closely with China to stop the chemicals used to create the deadly synthetic opioid fentanyl from reaching North America, said Prime Minister Mark Carney’s point person for fighting the opioid crisis.
title: Canada’s Fentanyl Czar Seeks Chinese Help to Stop Precursors

author: Wes Kosova
description: The party’s frustrated upstarts aim to shake up its leadership with a big year coming up for US politics.
title: Democrats From Schumer to Mamdani to AOC Face Big Year in 2026

author: Naureen S Malik
description: The outcome of what was, until recently, an obscure US power market auction will be the subject of intense interest this week for electric generators, regulators and consumers alike.
title: Biggest US Power Auction Set to Deepen Affordability Concerns

author: Emily Nicolle
description: The proportion of Brits that hold crypto declined to around 8% of the adult population this year, despite record prices earlier in the year and a major push by the industry to break into the mainstream.
title: Crypto Ownership in UK Falls to 8% Despite Political Momentum

author: Rosalind Mathieson
description: The prime minster faces a far-right rush to blame migration.
title: Albanese Treads a Toxic Political Path After Bondi Attack

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer tried to hold President Donald Trump close this year in a bid to shield the UK from the sharp end of his trade policies. Right now, that strategy is struggling to pay dividends.
title: Starmer’s Trump-Whispering Tested by Rifts Over BBC and Tech

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The Rwanda-backed M23 rebel said it will withdraw from eastern Democratic Republic of Congo’s third-biggest city, under US pressure.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels to Withdraw from Eastern Congo City

author: Tom Rees
description: British businesses enjoyed the sharpest pickup in new work in more than a year, according to a survey that suggests firms were buoyed by an end to months of speculation around the budget.
title: UK Firms See a Post-Budget Surge in New Orders, PMI Shows

description:
This is the story of how an Arizona woman’s house became a gateway for North Korea’s IT operatives - an underground “laptop farm” that infiltrated US companies and pumped millions to the regime.

 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: North Korea’s Hidden Remote IT Scheme

author: Craig Stirling
description: Belgium must act to fix its public finances or risk the need for more drastic efforts if financial markets force the government’s hand, according to the International Monetary Fund.
title: Belgium Told by IMF to Act on Debt Load or Risk Market Backlash

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, stocks in Asia slump, while futures point to another day of losses, as traders hold fire ahead of today's delayed data on the US labor market.

President Trump says a deal to end the war in Ukraine is closer than ever. But President Zelenskiy makes clear that territory remains a key disagreement.

And the US President has sued the BBC for at least $10 billion over a misleading edit in a documentary last year that gave the impression he’d made a direct call for violence in a speech leading up to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol by his supporters.

Today's guest: Tineke Frikkee, Head of UK Equity Research at W1M. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Offers Ukraine Security Guarantee & Trump Sues BBC for $10B | Daybreak Europe 12/16/2025

author: Isabel Reynolds, Ryo Horiuchi
description: Japan plans to require individuals to reveal their nationality when acquiring real estate, the Justice Minister announced Tuesday, after rising prices led to concerns that foreign speculation was putting homes out of reach of citizens.
title: Japan to Require Real Estate Buyers to Reveal Nationality

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he has an agreement with the US to make security guarantees legally binding through a vote in Congress as part of a deal to end Russia’s war.
title: Zelenskiy Says US Pledged Congress Will Back Security Guarantees

author: Angus Whitley, Nasteho Said
description: Thefts of Australia’s millions of registered firearms have become the country’s biggest source of illegally-held guns, underscoring a need to limit ownership in the wake of Sunday’s shootings at Bondi Beach, according to a think tank.
title: Australia Gun Crackdown Needed as Thefts Soar, Think Tank Says

description: US negotiators offered more significant security guarantees to Kyiv as part of President Donald Trump’s renewed push to end the Russia-Ukraine war. The US offered to provide “Article 5-like” security guarantees as part of the current deal to find a diplomatic solution to the conflict, a US official told reporters. Even as he lauded the progress on guarantees, Ukrainian President Zelenskiy made clear the positions between Moscow and Kyiv when it comes to territory lie far apart. Bloomberg’s Olive
title: US Offers Ukraine ‘Article 5-Like’ Security Guarantees

author: Anisah Shukry, Ram Anand
description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim named new trade and economy chiefs on Tuesday, as part of a broad revamp to address some monthslong vacancies in his government.
title: Malaysia PM Names New Trade, Economy Chiefs in Cabinet Reset

author: Selcuk Gokoluk, Andras Gergely
description: The standout developing-nation currency in the year of emerging markets — Hungary’s forint — is looking increasingly vulnerable as 2026 nears.
title: Forint Looks Vulnerable as Hungary Risks Surge After 2025 Rally

author: Kirsi Heikel, Slav Okov, Andrea Palasciano
description: Leaders of eight easternmost European Union nations are gathering in Helsinki on Tuesday to plot a roadmap for how to secure as much funding as possible for building up defenses against Russia.
title: EU’s Eastern Flank States Team Up to Seek Funds for Defense Against Russia

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Billionaire politician Thaksin Shinawatra’s family, which has dominated Thai politics this century, has nominated another member of the dynasty as a prime minister candidate in the election scheduled for early next year.
title: Thaksin-Backed Party Picks Another Family Member as Thai PM Candidate

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan’s President Lai Ching-te has escalated his rhetoric against opposition parties by accusing them of abusing their legislative power, as the island descends into partisan strife after a clash over fiscal spending.
title: Taiwan Reels From Political Faceoff Between President, Opponents

author: John Harney
description: The US military has attacked three more alleged drug boats, killing a total of eight people, the US Southern Command said Monday night.
title: US Military Carries Out Deadly Attacks on Three Boats in Pacific

author: Neil Jerome Morales
description: Philippine immigration authorities said the father and son accused of killing 15 people in Sydney visited the country last month and traveled on Indian passports.
title: Philippines Says Bondi Shooters Visited on Indian Passports

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party and its junior partner the Japan Innovation Party will skip pushing for a bill on cutting the number of parliamentary seats during the current diet session, walking back from an initial coalition agreement to pass the bill by year-end.
title: Japan’s Ruling Bloc to Delay Debate Over Cutting Lawmaker Seats

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A group of Democratic state attorneys general dropped one of the last remaining legal fights over whether President Donald Trump unlawfully delegated too much power to Elon Musk during the months the billionaire served within the administration.
title: State Officials Drop Fight Over Elon Musk’s US Government Role

author: Erica Yokoyama, Kamil Kowalcze, Kate Sullivan
description: Washington is set to begin its turn as chair of the Group of 20 by reducing the number of meetings among finance chiefs, people familiar with the matter said, in an apparent move to streamline the multilateral process.
title: US Plans to Reduce the Number of G-20 Finance Minister Meetings

author: Steven T. Dennis, Erik Wasson
description: A bipartisan group of senators is making a long-shot bid to break a stalemate over health care subsidies, while also acknowledging that time has run out to pass legislation before the credits expire Dec. 31.
title: Senators Scramble for Health Subsidy Solution as Time Runs Out

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Jake Auchincloss (D-MA) voices his frustration with President Trump's remarks following the death of film director Rob Reiner & talks about whether or not he thinks the health care fight will be resolved this week. Evelyn Farkas, Executive Director of the McCain Institute, discusses the latest on the Ukraine Russia peace plan. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Republicans Rebuff Trump's Post on Rob Reiner | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/15/2025

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump sued the BBC for at least $10 billion over a misleading edit in a documentary last year that gave the impression he’d made a direct call for violence in a speech leading up to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol by his supporters.
title: Trump Sues BBC for $10 Billion Over 2024 Documentary Edit

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump sued the BBC for $5 billion over a misleading edit in a documentary last year that gave the impression he’d made a direct call for violence in a speech leading up to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol by his supporters.
title: Trump Sues BBC for $5 Billion Over 2024 Documentary Edit

author: Allyson Versprille
description: Cutting flights across 40 major airports during the US government shutdown earlier this year was necessary to protect the safety of the flying public, the head of the US Federal Aviation Administration plans to tell lawmakers on Tuesday.
title: FAA Chief Defends Flights Cuts During Shutdown, Cites Safety
